0:
apk add --no-cache jq;
until true; do
  echo "Checking fileflows status..."
  STATUS=$(curl -s --max-time 3 http://fileflows:5000/api/status)
  if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "fileflows unreachable, proceeding"
    exit 0
  fi

  PROCESSING=$(echo "$STATUS" | jq '.processing // 0')
  QUEUE=$(echo "$STATUS" | jq '.queue // 0')
  echo "Processing: $PROCESSING, Queue: $QUEUE"

  if [ "$PROCESSING" -eq 0 ] && [ "$QUEUE" -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "Processing and Queue are both 0"
    exit 0
  fi

  echo "Processing > 0, waiting"
  sleep 120
done
Secure note taking and to-do app with synchronisation capabilities
Bookmark manager that is designed be to be minimal and fast
Saves the precious readable content of web pages to keep forever.

/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-labs-helm-app-template.title: redis helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-labs-helm-app-template.name: redis
/hr/ghcr.io-bjw-s-labs-helm-app-template.doc:
Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that is used as a database, cache, and message broker. It provides a fast and flexible solution for storing and retrieving data, making it an ideal choice for a wide range of use cases, including real-time analytics, session management, and more.

Redis is used by Authentik, Authelia, oauth2-proxy.

/hr/ghcr.io-rook-rook-ceph-rook-ceph-ope.title: rook-ceph-operator helm release
/hr/ghcr.io-rook-rook-ceph-rook-ceph-ope.name: rook-ceph-operator
/hr/ghcr.io-rook-rook-ceph-rook-ceph-ope.doc:
Rook Ceph is a Kubernetes operator that can be used to manage Ceph storage clusters on Kubernetes. Ceph is a distributed storage system that provides block, object, and file storage for your home lab, and Rook makes it easy to deploy and manage Ceph storage clusters on top of Kubernetes. This allows you to store and access your data from anywhere in the cluster, such pods are not stuck to a single node, like with local-path storage.

With Ceph Block devices you can use Ceph as a persistent storage solution for your Kubernetes cluster. You can create a storage class that will automatically provision a Ceph block device for your pods.

After deploying the operator, you can deploy Rook Ceph clusters via the Rook Ceph Cluster chart.
